name: 廣義相對論（一）
syllabus:
**\[16 weeks\]**

**week 1** overview of SR (Special Relativity) and GR (General Relativity), spacetime geometry, inertial frame and Lorentz transformation, Coordinate and Lorentz invariance, geometrized units

**week 2** SR revisited, Lorentz contraction, aberration of light, four-vector, understanding gravity=acceleration=curved spacetime

**week 3** parameterized a worldline, four-vectors, three accelerations, covariant/contravariant transformation, dual tensor and one-form

**week 4** tensor transformation, affine parameter, connection coefficient (Christoffel symbol), geodesics

**week 5** connection coefficient revisited, torsion tensor, covariant derivative for tensors and metric, geodesics revisited, acceleration in SR and Rindler horizon

**week 6** local inertial frame, Riemann curvature tensor and examples, Ricci tensor, Ricci scalar, Stress-energy-momentum tensor, conservation laws

**week 7** Einstein Field Equation, Einstein tensor, Bianchi identity and contracted forms, Newtonian limit and Poisson equation, weak energy condition, wormhole and time travel

**week 8** midterm

**week 9** review of the 1st part of the lecture

**week 10:** important principles in GR, Weyl tensor and Petrov classifications, Schwarzschild metric, Killing vectors

**week 11:** no-hair theorem, Birkhoff's theorem, Kerr-hoposisthes, hovering/infalling/orbiting observers, geodesics around black holes, black hole shadow, rotating black holes, Penrose process

**week 12:** Cosmological principles, Roberson-Walker metric, Hubble’s law, Friedmann equations, cosmological constant, Friedmann equations

**week 13:** Concordance cosmological models, thermal history of the Universe, cosmological inflation, redshift vs. the size of the Universe, age/edge of the Universe

**week 14:** Gravitational wave and linearized gravity, quadrupole radiation, chirp system, gravitational wave modes and polarization

**week 15:** gravitational wave detection and spectrum, types of gravitational waves, final remarks

**week 16:** final exam

methodologies.note: ask students to discuss their understandings about the key concepts

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
